Activity: Arrive at work, check emails. Look at the funny cat video sent by my wife. Review the preliminary technical specification document created yesterday.
Refine the technical specification document based on yesterday's research and best practices. Add more details on data types, field lengths, validation rules, and workflow customizations.
Contact @dba-1 to discuss the database schema and potential impact of the proposed EHR system updates/modifications. Get their input on data storage, indexing, and performance considerations.

Create a detailed data dictionary for the new data fields. This dictionary should include field names, data types, descriptions, validation rules, and any other relevant information. Share with @da-1 and @da-2

Start prototyping some of the workflow customizations in a test environment. Experiment with different approaches for capturing data and guiding clinicians through the data collection process.

Conduct a preliminary risk assessment of the proposed EHR system updates/modifications. Identify potential challenges and develop mitigation strategies. Consider factors such as data migration, system downtime, and user training.
Update the technical specification document with the risk assessment findings and mitigation strategies. Ensure that the document is comprehensive and addresses all potential concerns.

Prepare a presentation summarizing the proposed EHR system updates/modifications. This presentation will be used to communicate the plan to stakeholders and get their buy-in. @itpm-1 should be included in the email
Review the week's progress and identify any outstanding tasks. Prioritize tasks for tomorrow based on urgency and importance.
Wrap up and head home. Might stop by the hardware store.
